cont.entity_a: Solid body with superior build quality compared to newer models.
cont.entity_b: Durable construction; survived a fall without damage.

cont.entity_a: 8fps and professional autofocus with 45 points. High ISO performance is usable despite older technology.
cont.entity_b: Performs flawlessly with higher quality results than previous models. Shutter speed is fast with very sharp pictures.

cont.entity_a: Not compatible with newer EF-S lenses.
cont.entity_b: Compatible with old K lenses, though not all are autofocus. Compatible with many K-mount and M42 screw mount lenses. Compatible with older Pentax lenses, providing a good value for existing users.

cont.entity_a: Low resolution at 4.2MP, but interpolation can be used for larger images.
cont.entity_b: Good image quality with accurate colors and ISO up to 3200.

cont.entity_a: Error 99 encountered and accessories difficult to find.
cont.entity_b: Very easy to use with a good range of auto features and modes. Some battery issues; requires high mAh NiMH rechargeables. Not suitable for fast succession of shots due to limited buffer size.

cont.entity_a: Considered overpriced if above $500 unless for collectors.
Great camera for general and close-up photography despite low resolution.

cont.entity_b: Small and portable, fits in a large purse.
Built-in anti-shake feature limits the need for expensive lenses. Image stabilization feature works well.
